result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lorenzo Trevonte Killingworth

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lorenzo Trevonte Killingworth not in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph P Bastien V in court for Lorenzo Trevonte Killingworth.  Defendant's appearance waived. Attorney William T. Berens in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for final pretrial. State waiting on DNA results and requested jury trial adjournment. Defense does not object. Court VACATES jury trial. Case adjourned for final pretrial and for jury trial in Branch 04; Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date. Final pre-trial scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 08:30 am. Jury trial scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lorenzo Trevonte Killingworth in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph P Bastien V in court for Lorenzo Trevonte Killingworth. Attorney William T. Berens in court for State of Wisconsin.  Final Pretrial held. Case remains in trial posture. State places offer on the record. Defendant rejected offer. Court sets additional final pretrial for status on crime lab testing. Case adjourned in Branch 4.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.
State's Witness List, received and filed.
Defendant's Motion in Limine, received and filed.
Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions, received and filed.

Attorney Joseph P Bastien in court, defendant Lorenzo Trevonte Killingworth not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed by the final pretrial date. Suppression motion must be filed by 8-5-2022. Any other motions must be filed by the final pretrial.  Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 4.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Joseph P Bastien in court.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference. Discovery and offer received. Defense requests more time for review. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lorenzo Trevonte Killingworth in court with Attorney Joseph P Bastien; both appear by video.  Defendant Lorenzo Trevonte Killingworth in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective K. Gordon. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lorenzo Trevonte Killingworth in court, in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case in court for preliminary hearing. SPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing. Case adjourned to Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with Keosha M.J.; Shavell G.J.; Lionel D.M.; Charles H.M.; Javon R.M.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Lorenzo Trevonte Killingworth in court with attorney Colleen Cullen.  Defendant Lorenzo Trevonte Killingworth in custody.  Matthew Richard Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lorenzo Trevonte Killingworth appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
